New Records: Anthony Davis scored 35 points, matching a career-high for the Lakers in the game.
The Lakers achieved a 2-0 start to the season, their first since the 2010-11 season.
Key Match Events: The Lakers trailed 81-74 with three minutes left in the third quarter before a 20-6 run to take the lead.
Kevin Durant led the Suns with 30 points, while Devin Booker contributed 23.
Post-Match Reflections: The Lakers' coach noted the victory as a significant step toward their goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns struggled in the second half, making 21 of 52 shots after a strong first half.
The Lakers had 14-of-27 3-pointers, with Austin Reaves leading with 5-of-7 from beyond the arc.
Others: The game was part of the NBA's schedule, with both teams set to play subsequent home games.
